RegionCovered.Title: No exposure detected
RegionCovered.Body: You have not been near anyone who reported a COVID-19 diagnosis through this app.
RegionCovered.AllSetBody: Your phone is now running Bluetooth to collect codes from nearby phones.

NoRegion.Title: No exposure detected
NoRegion.Body:
You have not been near anyone who reported a COVID-19 diagnosis through this app.

However, in some provinces and territories, people cannot yet report COVID-19 diagnoses through this app.
NoRegion.AllSetBody:
We’ll let you know as soon as people outside Ontario can report a diagnosis through COVID Alert.

It’s still helpful to keep COVID Alert on.

That way, when people are able to report a diagnosis, you’ll find out if you were near them.

RegionNotCovered.Title: No reporting yet in your area
RegionNotCovered.Body:
People in your province or territory are not yet able to report a COVID-19 diagnosis through this app.

It’s still helpful to turn COVID Alert on. That way, when people are able to report a diagnosis, you’ll be notified if you were near them.
RegionNotCovered.AllSetBody:
We’ll let you know as soon as people in your area can report a diagnosis through COVID Alert.

It’s still helpful to keep COVID Alert on.

That way, when people are able to report a diagnosis, you’ll find out if you were near them.

ExposureDetected.Title: You’ve been exposed
ExposureDetected.Body1: In the last 14 days, you’ve been near someone who reported a COVID-19 diagnosis.
ExposureDetected.Body2: You’re at risk of being infected.

Home.ExposedHelpCTA: What to do if you’re exposed

DiagnosedView.Title: Thanks for helping fight COVID-19

Body1.One: Tomorrow, you’ll get your last notification asking permission to upload any new random codes your phone sent out.
Body1.Other: For the next {number} days, you’ll get a daily notification asking permission to upload any new random codes your phone sent out.

DiagnosedView.Body2: You do not have to agree, even if you agreed the day before.
DiagnosedView.Body3: If you’re worried about your symptoms, get medical care as soon as you can. Take care of yourself and your family during this time.

DiagnosedShareView.Title: Upload random codes
DiagnosedShareView.Body1: Thanks for helping slow the spread!
DiagnosedShareView.Body3: To help keep people safe, you need to upload your random codes every day, especially if you have to leave your home.

Home.EnableBluetoothCTA: You need to turn on Bluetooth in your phone’s settings so COVID Alert can work.

EnUnauthorized.Title: COVID Alert is off
EnUnauthorized.Body1: From the button below, choose Exposure Notifications, then scroll down and turn on "Share Exposure Information".

EnDisabled.Title: COVID Alert is off
EnDisabled.Body1: You did not enable COVID Alert. The app needs your permission to work.
EnDisabled.AndroidTitle2: Not sure about turning on Location?
EnDisabled.AndroidBody1: You need to have Location turned on for COVID Alert to work. To use Bluetooth scanning, Android phones need Location setting on for all apps.
EnDisabled.AndroidBody2b: no way of knowing where you are.
EnDisabled.AndroidBody2c: You can check the app’s permissions in your phone’s settings. You’ll see it does not have permission for location services.

FrameworkUnavailable.Title: Something went wrong
FrameworkUnavailable.Body:
COVID Alert is not supported by your phone’s operating system.

Make sure your operating system is up to date.

If you have an Android phone, try updating your Google Play Services.

UnknownProblem.Title: Something went wrong
UnknownProblem.Body: It looks like your phone cannot support COVID Alert.

Home.NoConnectivityDetailed: COVID Alert only checks for exposure if your phone is connected to the Internet.

OverlayOpen.BluetoothCardBody: You need to turn on Bluetooth in your phone’s settings so COVID Alert can work.
OverlayOpen.EnterCodeCardBody: To let people know they’ve been exposed, you need a one-time key. We’ll also ask for details to help narrow down when you were likely most contagious.
OverlayOpen.EnterCodeCardBodyDiagnosed: Thank you for doing your part to slow the spread.
OverlayOpen.NotificationCardBody: You will not receive notifications if you’ve been near anyone who has reported a COVID-19 diagnosis. Finding out potential exposures right away is essential to slowing the spread of COVID-19.
OverlayOpen.ExposureNotificationCardBody: COVID Alert cannot notify you as soon as it learns of a possible exposure. Finding out right away is essential to slowing the spread of COVID-19.
OverlayOpen.NoConnectivityCardBody: Connect to the Internet to notify people or check for exposures.
OverlayOpen.EnUnauthorizedCardBody: Choose Exposure Notifications, then scroll down and turn on "Share Exposure Information".

Landing.AltText: Illustration of 8 people enjoying a public space. There’s a person with a walking cane, a person in a wheelchair, a person wearing a hijab, several people of colour, and a representation of gender diversity.
Landing.CanadaAltText: Symbol of the Government of Canada

Tutorial.step-1AltText: A hand-drawn illustration of a mobile phone in a pocket, sending and receiving signals.
Tutorial.step-1:
The app runs in the background and will not interrupt your activities.

Whenever you’re near someone else with COVID Alert, both phones exchange random codes every 5 minutes.

The random codes change often and cannot be used to identify you.
Tutorial.step-2AltText: A hand-drawn illustration of 2 mobile phones side-by-side with a timer clock connecting both phones.
Tutorial.step-2:
The app estimates how near people are by the strength of Bluetooth signals.

The app will record an exposure if the contact:
• Is closer than 2 metres.
• Lasts at least 15 minutes.
• Happens during the time the person was likely most contagious.
Tutorial.step-3AltText: A hand-drawn illustration of a mobile phone uploading a numeric code to a cloud.
Tutorial.step-3:
If a person with the app is diagnosed with COVID-19, they can choose to upload the random codes their phone sent.

They can also give details to help narrow down when they were likely most contagious. Those details tell the phone which random codes to upload.

The random codes go into a central server. No other information is sent to the server.
Tutorial.step-4AltText: A hand-drawn illustration of a mobile phone uploading a numeric code to a cloud.
Tutorial.step-4:
Every day, whenever it has an Internet connection, your phone will get a list of the random codes from people who reported a diagnosis.

If it finds codes that match, the app notifies you that you’ve been exposed and explains what to do next.

Sharing.Title: Tell your friends about COVID Alert
Sharing.SubTitle: Every person using COVID Alert helps to slow the spread of COVID-19. Sharing this app will not share any of your personal information.
Sharing.Message: Join me in helping to slow the spread of COVID-19. Download the COVID Alert app: https://covidshield.app

Start.Title: Together, let’s stop the spread of COVID-19
Start.ImageAltText: A hand-drawn illustration with lots of different people in it. Dotted lines show their paths crossing and leading to a smartphone below.
Start.Body1: COVID Alert helps us break the cycle of infection. The app can let people know of possible exposures before any symptoms appear.
Start.Body2: That way, we can take care of ourselves and protect our communities.

WhatItsNot.Title: What COVID Alert does not do
WhatItsNot.ImageAltText: A hand-drawn illustration with many houses and a high-rise building on a curving street. Small message bubbles appear above each home.
WhatItsNot.Body1: The app will not tell you in the moment if you’re currently near someone who’s been diagnosed.
WhatItsNot.Body2: It will not tell you about outbreaks in your community.

Anonymous.Title: Your privacy is protected
Anonymous.ImageAltText: A hand-drawn illustration of shaded glasses and hat to go incognito. Above the hat, a location pin icon is crossed out.
Anonymous.Body1: COVID Alert **does not use GPS** or track your location.
Anonymous.Bullet4: Your health information, except what you decide to share.
Anonymous.Bullet5: The health information of anyone you’re near.

HowItWorks.Title: How it works
HowItWorks.ImageAltText: A hand-drawn illustration of 3 mobile phones sending out random codes via bluetooth.
HowItWorks.Body1: The app uses Bluetooth to exchange random codes with nearby phones.
HowItWorks.Body2: Every day, it checks a list of random codes from people who tell the app they tested positive.
HowItWorks.Body3: If you’ve been near one of those people within the last 14 days, you’ll get a notification.
HowItWorks.HowItWorksCTA: Learn more about how it works

PartOf.Title: One part of public health
PartOf.ImageAltText: A hand-drawn illustration of different ways of fighting COVID-19, including hand sanitizer, handwashing, face mask and the COVID Alert app.
PartOf.Body1: COVID Alert is just one part of the public health effort to stop the spread of COVID-19.
PartOf.Body2: Follow all public health guidelines in your area.
PartOf.Body3: COVID Alert does not replace medical advice. If you get sick, contact your doctor or other healthcare provider.

Permissions.Title: The app will now ask your permission
Permissions.ImageAltText: A hand-drawn illustration of a mobile phone displaying a dialogue box with a red X and a green check mark on the screen.
Permissions.Body1: **Allow the app** to start logging random codes or “random IDs” when you’re near other phones. The app will access the date, duration and signal strength related to the random codes, but they never leave your phone.
Permissions.Body2: You’ll also need to **let the app send you notifications**.

ThankYou.Title: Thank you for helping
ThankYou.Body: Exposure notifications are on. You will receive a message if COVID Alert detects that you’ve been near someone who has reported a COVID-19 diagnosis.

DataUpload.InfoSmall: Your random codes will not be uploaded unless you give permission in the next step.

Step0.Title: Notify people they’ve been exposed

List.1b: you got when you were diagnosed.
List.2b: to help narrow down when you were likely most contagious. You can choose not to give any details.
List.3b: your random codes. These codes notify people you’ve been near.

Step0.Body1: Nobody will get any information about you
Step0.Body2: or the time you were near them. They will only get a notification that they were exposed recently.

Symptoms.5: New loss of smell or taste.

Step2.Option1: Yes, you have or had at least 1 symptom within the last 14 days.
Step2.Option2: No, you’ve not had any symptoms.
Step2.Body2: This information helps figure out when you were likely most contagious. It tells the app which exposures to share so only people who were near you during that time will be notified. It will never be sent or stored outside your phone.

FormView.Title: Enter your one-time key
FormView.Body: Enter the key you got when you were diagnosed. To prevent false notifications, you can only get a key if you test positive for COVID-19.

OtkDiagnosedView.Title: You've already entered the key
OtkDiagnosedView.Body: You do not need to enter it again.

ConsentView.Title: Now you can upload your codes
ConsentView.Body1: Your phone will ask your permission to upload your most recent random codes or “random IDs”.
ConsentView.Body2a: Nobody will get any information about you
ConsentView.Body2b: or the time you were near them.
ConsentView.Body3: You can help slow the spread of COVID-19 if you agree.

TekUploadNoDate.Title: Notify people you've been near
TekUploadNoDate.Body:
You did not give a date to help narrow down when you were likely most contagious.

Share your exposures now to notify the people you were near in the last 14 days.

SymptomOnsetDate.Body1:
This date helps figure out when you were likely most contagious. It tells the app which exposures to share so only people who were near you during that time will be notified.

The date does not get sent or stored anywhere outside your phone.

TestDate.Body1: Enter the date you got your COVID-19 test.
TestDate.Body2:
Your test date helps figure out when you were likely most contagious. It tells the app which exposures to share so only people who were near you then will be notified.

The date does not get sent or stored anywhere outside your phone.

NoRegion.Title: You skipped choosing province or territory
NoRegion.Body:
In some provinces and territories, people cannot yet report a COVID-19 diagnosis through this app.

To find out if you can get a one-time key, you need to choose your area.

RegionNotCovered.Title: No reporting yet in your area
RegionNotCovered.Body:
People in your area cannot yet get a one-time key.

You will not be able to let people know they were exposed. But you can still self-isolate for 14 days, and:
RegionNotCovered.Body3: Protect people and pets you live with.

Notification.ExposedMessageBody: You’ve had close contact with someone who reported a COVID-19 diagnosis through the app. Learn more about what to do next.
Notification.OffMessageBody: Turn on COVID Alert to get notified if you’ve been near someone who has reported a COVID-19 diagnosis.
Notification.DailyUploadNotificationBody: Help slow the spread of COVID-19 and upload your new random codes.

BottomSheet.OnStatus: COVID Alert is on, Tap for more information
BottomSheet.OffStatus: COVID Alert is off, Tap for more information

RegionLanding.Title: Choose your province or territory
RegionLanding.Body1: Provincial and territorial governments are working to support COVID Alert across Canada.
RegionLanding.Body2: In some places, people cannot yet report a COVID-19 diagnosis through this app.

RegionPicker.Title: Where do you live? (optional)
RegionPicker.Body:
Choose your region to check if you can report a diagnosis through this app.

Your region will never be shared with anyone.

TekUploadNoDate.Body: You need to choose a date before you can share exposures.

TekUploadOffline.Title: Lost connection
TekUploadOffline.Body: Your random codes were not uploaded. Make sure your phone is connected to the Internet, through either data or WiFi.

TekUploadServer.Title: Try again later
TekUploadServer.Body: Something went wrong with the system.

TekUploadPermission.Title: Random codes could not be uploaded

OtcCodeNotEntered.Body: You need to enter your key before you can submit.

OtcUploadInvalidOneTimeCode.Title: Incorrect key
OtcUploadInvalidOneTimeCode.Body: Your one-time key could not be recognized. Please try again.

OtcUploadTemporaryBan.Title: Wait for 1 hour
OtcUploadTemporaryBan.Body: You’ve tried to enter a one-time key too many times.

OtcUploadDefault.Title: Try again later
OtcUploadDefault.Body: Something went wrong with the system.

OtcUploadOffline.Title: Lost connection
OtcUploadOffline.Body: Your key was not sent. Make sure your phone is connected to the Internet, through either data or WiFi.

ContentNoConnect.Title: Cannot connect to information for your province or territory
ContentNoConnect.Body: Try again later for this information.

DataSharingStep2.Body: You need to choose an answer before going to the next step.

ApiNotConnected.Title: Something went wrong
ApiNotConnected.Body:
Unfortunately, it looks like COVID Alert will not work on this phone. 

If you have more than one profile on your phone, try installing the app in the main profile.
